newsitem.title: CHINA: China indignant at Europe prize for dissident.
newsitem.headline: China indignant at Europe prize for dissident.

text.p: China on Friday expressed anger and regret at the European Parliament's decision to award the 1996 Sakharov prize for freedom of thought to jailed dissident Wei Jingsheng.
"The decision of the European Parliament to award Wei Jingsheng is in reality an encouragement to activities against the Chinese government," the Chinese Foreign Ministry said.
"It is a rude interference in China's internal affairs and judicial jurisdiction," it said. "We express great regret and anger at this decision of the European Parliament."
The European Parliament announced on Thursday that Wei had won the 15,000 Ecu ($19,000) Sakharov prize for freedom of thought, to be awarded at a ceremony in Strasbourg in December.
Wei's family has welcomed the award to the dissident, who was jailed for 15 years in 1979 and had been paroled for less than a year before being detained again in April 1994.
